channel.title: Appearance of artefacts on the screen
channel.description:
When using PrintScreen, artifacts are not visible in the photograph. So I took a picture on the phone.
![1|375x500](upload://sovEcnXXhgg0qpNOvSX0lTzCzYL.jpeg) ![2|375x500](upload://y81JFkrbhuvDz92ztRZ3sk7VaDc.jpeg) ![3|375x500](upload://cEPBrS4LpTxdqSGDrLSm74L3FU4.jpeg) ![4|640x480](upload://cEd3fkdFzxdXDd3YCW8IcLvmtUY.jpeg) ![5|640x480](upload://eFhY4FkHmoWse5hdmbTj0n2CGLP.jpeg)
Artifacts appear after a new installation of QubesOS. I open the console and whonixcheck in two TemplateVM GW/WS (Whonix). After the launch, artifacts appear. I restart the computer and see these artifacts in the boot menu and when the OS boots. Also, they do not immediately disappear after loading OS. The solution is that I turn off the computer for a while, and after turning on these artifacts disappear. There are no such problems with Whonix AppVM. Only with Whonix TemplateVM. Also, I never came across these artifacts when using the non-whonix AppVM / TemplateVM. When using whonix in kvm, these artifacts also occur, but not as much as in qubesOS. After artifacts appear, if me connect the monitor to another computer, these artifacts will be visible, but after a while they will disappear. I could not trace exactly what these artifacts were connected with, but I think that this is connected with the monitor. Moreover, as I described above, such problems do not occur when using other distributions in TemplateVM / AppVM, as well as in KVM.
Can these artifacts relate to Whonix or look for the cause in my hardware?

item.title: Appearance of artefacts on the screen
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
5sharpknives:

45.35.192.34

A Tor relay.

  • ExoneraTor: a Website Tool [archive] to Check for Tor Relay IP Addresses
whonix.org – 3 Jan 17

ExoneraTor - Whonix

ExoneraTor is a website hosted by The Tor Project that tells you whether a given IP address was a Tor relay.

Quote:

  • https://metrics.torproject.org/exonerator.html?ip=45.35.192.34&timestamp=2020-03-28&lang=en
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200330160439/https://metrics.torproject.org/exonerator.html?ip=45.35.192.34&timestamp=2020-03-28&lang=en

We found one or more Tor relays on IP address 45.35.192.34 on or within a day of 2020-03-28 that Tor clients were likely to know.

whonix.org – 4 Sep 19

Whonix and Tor - Whonix

Why does Whonix ™ use Tor? Why is Tor slow? Download Whonix ™. Anonymity online. Privacy protection.

Read full topic
item.source: Appearance of artefacts on the screen

item.title: Appearance of artefacts on the screen
item.dc:creator: kelman
item.description:
Patrick_mobile:

Could you report to https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues please?

Good, i reported.

github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues

Appearance of artefacts on the screen

opened 08:20PM - 18 Mar 20 UTC
TerrikG1

Qubes OS version R4.0.3 Affected component(s) or functionality Xfce, GUI Brief summary Artifacts on the screen, as well as twitching graphics. Small stripes. Slightly disappears when...

P: default T: bug

Read full topic
